bestBHT.bht: Jesus was amazed by the woman's great faith and her quick and bright repartee that pleased Him. In an instant, the devil was gone from her daughter as a result of her saying. Though Jesus had missed his rest, it was worth it to answer a call like this. Christ, in a secret and powerful manner, had cast the devil out of the woman's daughter without physically going to her or speaking to the demon, showcasing His omnipotent power.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Jesus 'marvelled' only at two things—faith and unbelief."
For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter—That moment the deed was done.
Philip Schaff: Mark 7:29. For this saying. As an evidence of her faith.
The demon is gone out. As He spoke, the miracle was performed (Matthew 15:28).
Archibald T. Robertson: She had faith, great faith as Matthew 15:28 shows, but it was her quick and bright repartee that pleased Jesus.
He had missed his rest, but it was worth it to answer a call like this.
John Gill: Go thy way; for with the blessing of this word, the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
Go thy way; in peace, thy request is granted; it is as thou wouldst have it.

Christ, who as God is every where, and whose divine power reaches to all places, persons, and things had, in a secret and powerful manner, cast the devil out of this woman's daughter; without going to her, or speaking to him, his power had wrought the miracle effectually.

bhtAttempts.bht: Jesus was amazed by the faith displayed by the woman in Mark 7:29. Her response to Jesus pleased Him, showing not only her faith but also her quick wit. In that moment, the demon was cast out of her daughter, fulfilling her request. Despite the fact that Jesus had missed out on rest, He considered it worthwhile to answer the call and perform this miracle. His power as God reached to all places and persons, enabling Him to perform the miracle effectively without physically being present.

Jesus was astounded by the woman's great faith, as evidenced by her quick and clever response. In that instant, her request was granted and the demon was cast out of her daughter. This encounter was worth Jesus missing out on rest, as it showcased both faith and the power of His word. His divine authority allowed Him to work the miracle without being physically present, demonstrating His omnipotence.

Jesus marveled at the woman's faith and the quick and bright reply that pleased Him. In an instant, the devil was gone from her daughter as a result of her saying. Though Jesus had sacrificed His rest, it was worth it to attend to such a remarkable call. His power as God operated discreetly yet effectively, casting out the demon from the woman's daughter without requiring His physical presence or direct communication.

Jesus was amazed by the woman's faith and her quick retort that pleased Him. In response to her saying, the demon departed from her daughter instantly. Despite Jesus missing His rest, He deemed it worthwhile to answer such a compelling call. His divine power accomplishing the miracle effectively, even without being physically present or speaking directly.

Jesus was amazed by the woman's great faith and her quick and bright repartee that pleased Him. In an instant, the devil was gone from her daughter as a result of her saying. Though Jesus had missed his rest, it was worth it to answer a call like this. Christ, in a secret and powerful manner, had cast the devil out of the woman's daughter without physically going to her or speaking to the demon, showcasing His omnipotent power.
